text: Acting Middle Counselor Atsutada (1648) by Kanō Naonobu was a mid-Heian waka and Japanese nobleman. He was designated a member of the Thirty-six Poetry Immortals, and was also known as the and . == Poetry == Many of Atsutada's poems written in correspondence with court women remain, and some are included in official poetry anthologies such as Gosen Wakashū. One of his poems is included in the famous anthology Hyakunin Isshu: == External links == *E-text of his poems in Japanese Category:906 births Category:943 deaths Category:Japanese male poets Category:Fujiwara clan Category:10th-century Japanese poets Category:Hyakunin Isshu poets
title: Fujiwara no Atsutada
